reviewText:
A nice game for achievement hunters, you can clear them up in a few hours.

The object of the game is to get at least one robot twin to escape the level, one robot starts off imprisioned, with almost no battery energy, whilst another is free with full energy. Every move consumes energy, which if run out of causes the robot to die. The free robot can find a release switch for his twin to escape, at which point he can collect battery energy from the path (by induction i suppose), and join and assist his twin in escape.

The puzzles start off easy, and progressively more complicated, and the last level was worth playing to ... enjoyable fun and entertaining. Go buy it.
voteText: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
This game looked kind of iffy to me, but I'm a big fan of puzzle platformers, and the resource management concept (in the form of energy) was intriguing; so, I decided to give it a try, and it's actually pretty fun!

The controls are very tight and responsive (almost too responsive!), and the graphics aren't too bad either. The gameplay itself is very simple, but the level design becomes more challenging (naturally) as the game progresses - that, combined with the energy management aspect, adds another level thinking to completing each puzzle.

I haven't played much yet, so I can't say how much more complex the game becomes, but so far it has been pretty simple; as such, I'd like if it were a bit more dynamic and challenging, but again, that may yet become the case as the challenges progress throughout each level.

I made a first impressions video for my YouTube channel, check it out if you want a sample of gameplay to help you make your decision! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OsPCgXT4mkE

reviewText:
Graphics - Good (supports many resolutions including 4k)
Controller support - mostly good (Partial control has menus using mouse for part of the game, but once you get in the game it is very good)
Sound-Good
Music-Doesn't stand out, but just fine
Gameplay - Fairly easy to start, but increasing difficulty with hard to locate switches.
Value - 5 dollars is a fair price, if you find it on sale even better.


Disclaimer: only played for about 30 minutes before i reviewed it but wanted to get a review up - I suspect this would be pretty cool to play with a friend on local cooperative and be fine for children as well as adults.  I may update review once i have tried a father and son cooperative game.

reviewText: I was hoping this would be a challenging puzzle platformer but it just seems too basic.  LIke the beginning of a good idea.  It's also clear that this was an Ouya/Android port which is never a good thing.

reviewText: Looks like it was ported from an Android device.  Maybe it's fun with two players but it's a pretty boring one player game.  Kindof reminded me of Lost VIkings, but with less personality.
